divs: Sighting DetailsWhile admiring the clear night sky, looking in a southerly direction, my friend and I were amazed to see a huge fireball streak through the sky from a North to South direction, and then explode. It was 9:05pm EDT. The flash of light lit up the sky, and was blinding. The object was larger than my thumb nail at arms length. A shock wave hit two minutes later at 9:07pm EDT. It lasted for .5 seconds and was like a thunder clap in the distance. We were both amazed and awed by the experience. TW
Summary: Massive fireball explodes then shock wave two minutes later
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Guelph
There were no other sightings in Guelph on or around September 25th 2009
